Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Ruth E
Reviews.Content: The hostal is in the heart of the Gothic Quarter, right off the Las Ramblas. It was a sanctuary from the busy streets and crowds of Easter weekend. It was fun to look down on the goings-on from our 4th floor balcony. The staff was helpful, spoke English fairly well and someone was on-duty at the front desk 24/7. Room was clean, a good size for a hostal and our beds were made and towels changed each day. We had no problem sleeping with the street noise (but I always wear earplugs.) No WiFi in the room, only in the lobby. A few stairs to climb with our heavy suitcases, but not a big deal. I would recommend that you NOT arrive to any lodging in the Gothic Quarter, juggling suitcases, bags, and purses after dark. Pick pockets in this area are plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah K
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location easy access to Las Ramblas. Overlooks beautiful square with authentic atmosphere. Room was small and bathroom small but who needs a huge room when visiting the most beautiful city of Barcelona!!! Staff friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: scottie8scotlans
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant 2 star hotel in the most central location. The rooms are basic but clean and comfortable with a safe. The bathroom had a bath and towels were changed daily. I had a small balcony looking over the Placa Oriel which gave a wonderful atmosphere. I used earplugs and slept very well. The staff were very helpful and the free computer was essential due to the pending general strike. I shall certainly return and would happily reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK.”
Reviews.Author: Pavel S
Reviews.Content: If you want to visit Barcelona and save some money, this is the hotel to pick. It's located just two steps away from La Rambla in a very cozy street close to wonderful breakfast and dinner places.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: svroni h
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in this small and very nice hotel! Had a small but very clean room with a large terrace and a great view! It`s a lovely place in the middle of gothic quarter. Staff is very friendly.We recommend this hotel warmly to everybody who wants to spend some beautiful days in the city of barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Good location & Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren M
Reviews.Content: Our hotel in Barcelona was nice. It was in a central location just down a street off of La Rambla in a small plaza. The area was relatively quiet for such a busy city but was close and walking distance to everything (well minus all Gaudi’s work but thats to be expected). Our rooms were quite tiny but they had air conditioning and all amenities we would need to be comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “No guests allowed, boring interior, no wifi on high floors”
Reviews.Author: Jeff M
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, my brother and I were very disappointed with our 3 night stay at El Jardi. He had stayed there five years ago and gotten a room on the top floor with a huge roof/terrace. We thought we were booking the same room, though we got a different room on the top floor with a smaller terrace (though this is not El Jardi's fault) it set the tone for our continued disappointment. The rules of the hotel permit ANY visitors (though this was not the case 5 years ago). A friend of mine from back in the USA is studying in Barcelona and she was not allowed to come in with us. Also, they will ask you to leave the lobby area after a relatively short time (we were told by one concierge that there is a FIVE MINUTE LIMIT IN THE LOBBY?!?!) Considering that it is the only place we were able to get wifi and communicate with the world we left behind, this seemed ridiculous. The walls are boring and white (though they finally put up some paintings in the lobby be the time we left). The one photo/drawing in our room was not quite pleasant, and the overall experience was not very impressive. The location is great, but for the money you can certainly live better in Barcelona.... For the same price our hotel in Madrid was about ten times as good (friendly, helpful, nice interior, beautiful views...) If you don't plan on ever being in your hotel, and if you preferably have a phone that works in Barcelona, this hotel may not be so bad, but for us it was a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lbiscuit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of October 2011. I chose a Standard Interior room which obviously was dark as I didn't have windows, but I didn't have any noise problems either! The airline lost my bag and the staff were helpful saying it will probably take a few days. It did arrive eventually and the next day another staff member checked to see if my bag had arrived. They also suggested some places to buy some necessities. My room was on a low floor so I was able to connect to wifi which was great. The room itself was very clean and it was a nice room. I also had a bath.. Location was great and I could walk to the airport bus in about 10 mins. There was also a metro on La Rambla. The foyer was great as you could sit on the balcony and look over the square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaAmado
Reviews.Content: Just arrive in Barcelona in summer with protest around, La Rambla was full and I was lost. Arrive and the host recieve me with a big smile, help, water and a nice room in one of the best locations in Gotic. I has WiFi service, nice and clean bed and bathroom, tv with the latest news and a fun square just right outside. In the morning, i got my breakfast served with care and love.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Martin H
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying at El Jardi, excellent staff on reception, very helpful and calm and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble for them, they are a credit to Barcelona. The location is excellent just off Ramblas, the rooms are small but clean and the hotel felt very safe. If you are looking for a place to stay in a great location with excellent reception staff then El Jardi would be an excellent choice. Just one tip if you are coming by train and metro and you exit at Liceu the hotel is just literally across the road from the metro and a two minute walk up a side street we wantdered up La Rambla before realising the hotel was closer to the Metro than we thought( 2-3 minutes walk) Train very good from Airport and the change at passeig gracia was easy Martin

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrottingChris
Reviews.Content: My husband, my best friend, and her husband stayed here in September for 4 nights during Festival Mercé. It was my best friend who picked this hotel, had I done the research for Barcelona hotels, I would have definitely paid more for a better hotel. The only two things this hotel has going for it are (1) the location - just a block away from the Ramblas and (2) free WIFI. Everything else, from the 10 Euro deposit for the TV remote, to the lack of replenishment of bathroom essentials (even toilet paper), the TINY hotel room, and the paper thin walls (our room was right next to the service area) made this hotel a place I would never set foot in again. Sure the price was "fairly decent" but trust me, spend an extra 50-100 Euro and you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: TravelHistory
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Spain and Barcelona was our first stop. We were very disappointed with this hotel. It was very small, dark, cramped & noisy. The beds are hard, hard, hard and the staff were not overly friendly. One of the evenings our toilet stopped working and we were told by the front desk staff, just leave it, we will fix it tomorrow........... The shower was so small that I could not get in or out, nor turn around comfortably and I am only 5'4" with a medium build. On the up side the room was clean. However, I would not recommend this hotel unless you are looking for a college dorm type atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Best hostal ever!”
Reviews.Author: 543Michelle
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect- we could get almost anywhere without using any metro or bus, plus the area surrounding is beautiful and variated. The staff were amazing- everybody were so nice and welcoming, helped us with everything at any time. ( they gave us great recommendations, and even called the sites for us to ask for information). The rooms are very small but very clean and the beds are comfortable. There is a free computer with internet and Wi Fi. The hostal serves a nice breakfast but it was cheaper to have it in one of the many cafe's in the barrio gotic, right bellow the hostal. VERY VERY VERY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: magda v
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great location within seconds walk of the rambles. its near a charming church and old square with lots of great restaurants and free entertainment. staff great and very helpful. the rooms are small but clean.there are stairs to negotiate before you get to the lift and there is no one to help you so be aware if you have heavy cases. breakfast is basic,but there are heaps of places to eat nearby. free use of computer. it is noisy until all hours but i loved being in the center of all the festivities and the shut windows are fairly sound proof. any inconvenience is worth the greart location. a great vintage clothes store across the square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JoannainLA
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location in a charming quarter of the Barri Gotic (gothic quarter). The staff were very friendly & helpful & I had no trouble at all utilizing the free wi-fi. I did get a room facing the plaza and it was very noisy all hours of the night & early morning (drunkards stumbling home from the bars & clean-up crew afterwards) If you want quiet, it's best to get a room without a window or view. The rooms are very basic but quite comfortable. The bathrooms are quite spacious & clean as well. I would stay here again. It was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: 17reader
Reviews.Content: This is a typical European hotel. It is well located - walk to the Rambles in minutes - and very clean. The rooms are tiny, so finding a place to open the luggage can be a challenge. There are stairs up to the first floor reception area, then a lift to the floors above - if it is working! The shower was the tiniest I've ever seen, but worked quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit can be a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Toine M
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Jardi is a good located hotel near the rablas and Placa Real. There are several restaurants at walking distance. We had a 3 person room that was big enough but the bathroom was a bit small. To take a shower was a challenge without changing the water termperature evey 5 seconds. The room was clean but basic. We did not take breakfast in the hotel since there are many opportunities in close to the hotel. The first night I did not put my earplugs in and waked up because of the noise outside. Because of the high building there is an echo but with earplugs not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but institutional look”
Reviews.Author: denaq
Reviews.Content: We had mixed feelings about this hotel. The location was great and the room was clean. We had an exterior room with a balcony, and it was fun to look out at the changing activity in the plaza below, and to be just a few steps from tapas bars and gelado stands. (Don't pay for the hotel breakfast, you can eat at an outdoor cafe for half the price.) The staff was nice and helpful, and there was free wifi and a computer. But the public areas and rooms were very institutional, the elevator was miniscule (I took the stairs and my husband went up and down with our suitcases), the shower was so small that we sometimes changed the temperature by bumping into the faucet (and we're both pretty skinny) and there was noise at night from garbage trucks and cafes locking up their tables. I don't know if we'd stay there again; it's not bad, it's just kind of quirky.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: OhioSally
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardi is in a great location right on a quaint plaza in the Gothic neighborhood. The rooms are simple and clean. My only complaint is that the man (who was extremely nice and helpful) who worked the night shift smoked in the lobby. It was really awful to walk into a small lobby full of smoke. We were also sort of surprised that the hotel wouldn't give us towels to take to the beach. Not only that but the girl behind the front desk made sure to ask the maid if she gave us some and she told the next shift worker not to give us fresh towels if we asked. Basically she really went out of her way to make sure we didn't get fresh towels which was sort of ridiculous. Other than that, this is a great place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “All Praises for the el Jardi Hostal.”
Reviews.Author: NorthWest T
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I spent 4 days and 3 lovely evenings in this splendid accommodation. The staff was very helpful with tour information and tips on where to go and not go. The room overlooked the plaza where the setting changed from performances to artists displaying their paintings to restaurants with their tables spread out for customers to enjoy tapas. The next time we visit Barcelona we will be staying here. Oswald Norton Seattle, WA USA

Reviews.Title: “We really liked it here!”
Reviews.Author: newka08
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be clean, with very friendly & helpful staff, good wifi in the common area, and an absolutely perfect location. We did not hear any of the street noise mentioned in some previous reviews. The rooms are small and basic, but completely adequate. The bathroom was clean & had ample hot water in the shower. Your level of satisfaction could be affected by your neighbors; the room walls are very thin. We were awakened by a noisy couple around 2am one night; however when the noise began the next night, a little pounding on the wall solved the problem. Other nights our sleep was not disturbed at all. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean, friendly & hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: localboy66
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a whirlwind trip to Spain spending 2 nights in Barcelona. In research we found this Hostal in a central location on a pedestrian street just off Las Ramblas at the Liceu metro stop. Being on a budget this was the best we could find for the level of accomodations. We booked an inside view room because it was only for 2 nights & thought it would be more quiet at night. It was a good choice as it was quiet at night. The room was very clean & comfortable. The bathroom was small & very clean. Air conditioning was central with thermostat so very quiet & cool. Wifi wireless in public room adjacent to front desk only. they also have a desktop computer to use if you dont have a laptop. The front desk staff was very helpful & hospitable. If you want to use the room safe, they hold a 20euro cash key deposit. If you want the remote for the TV, they hold another 10euro deposit. Be advised that the hostal is 20 steps above ground level in case you have a lot or large luggage. They advertise an elevator but this is after the 20 steps. Also, the elevator starts another 10 steps to go from the 1st level or higher (which is actually more like the 2nd level). The elevator is very small- 1 person, 1 bag or 2 persons. Location is hard to beat, about half way down the Ramblas between the port & Plaza Catalunya (Almost across the Ramblas to Boqueria market). Felt very safe here. About a 15 minute walk to plaza Catalunya to catch airport bus. Overall, we liked our stay for the money & except for the stairs. Other small hotels & hostals are about 10euros more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JAX148
Reviews.Content: This location is excellent...overlooks a local square with lots of good restaurants and a bakery right downstairs. The hotel breakfast was adequate continental but the bakery was better and visited by the locals. Although some reviews complained of the outside night noise, we slept with a sound machine with the windows closed so we had no problem. Our friends had their windows open and were bothered by some of the outside night noise.The rooms are European small (we had to store a suitcase in the bathroom) but the price for the location is great. The individual room air conditioning was excellent. There is no elevator from the street to first floor reception (in the US we would consider this the second floor) so if you can not carry your own bags up one flight of stairs this is not the place for you. We had arranged for the hotels transportation from the airport but the van was broken on the day we arrived...make sure you give the hotel a cell phone number in advance so they can apprise you of any problems. We did use their van to the cruise ship and service was excellent. The hotel is located in a hard to find area for taxis and limited traffic is allowed so the hotel transportation is a good option. The hotel staff was very accomodating and helpful with attraction advice.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you Want”
Reviews.Author: avissantacruz
Reviews.Content: This great little hotel had it all. Great price, fantastic location on its own little plaza just a few windy streets off the Ramblas. When we arrived there was a local art show in the plaza, there are also a number of restaurants there so you can pop out and have a drink or meal anytime. You really felt like you were Spain here and not like you just hopped off a cruise ship and were swarming about with the tide on the Ramblas. The staff were helpful, they all spoke English! and the room was spotless! A simple breafast was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: BlancheIowa
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Jardi, and we loved it again. The square it's on is so pleasant; you can walk to all kinds of attractions; the Metro is five minutes away and so is La Boqueria with all of the scrumptious fruit you could want. We attended an exceptionally fine guitar concert at the little church on the square. Our room was very small but adequate--the terrace made it seem more spacious. The bed was a bit firm for our tastes. Desk clerks were exceptionally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: JennyAnnT
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel with two friends in May. The staff were excellent, the room was clean, tidy and practical and the location was fantastic. We all said we would return again with our husbands next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very small rooms but clean”
Reviews.Author: Tash28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The hotel is fine, with a fantastic location, friendly staff and clean rooms. The main issue was that the rooms, particularly the bathroom was very small and the hotel lacked character. However location and cleanliness were more important to us and therefore we were happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly relaxing”
Reviews.Author: kamatshaivee
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardi is located between two quiet places in Barcelona's Gothic Quarter. Ask for an 'Outside' room, and you have your own private balcony with a postcard view. You can see other tourists walking, and the expression on their face clearly indicates they think you've spent too much on your room. 'Inside' rooms are much more spartan, and I do not recommend them. It seems that the only meal they serve at the restaurant is breakfast, but it is a great way to start the day. You can sit outside and watch as the sun greets the dawn of a neighborhood as it has for centuries. Vehicular traffic is allowed in the region are only emergency vehicles (rare) and early morning delivery vans for the shops and restaurants facing the square. You are a block or so off Ramabalas, and about 2 blocks from the main cathedral. You are also within walking distance of the Four Gatos, a cafe where Picasso spent part of his youth.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and good service”
Reviews.Author: truthandlove
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after spending new year in Barcelona. Our room with a terrace overlooked a small quiet square and church, it was the perfect location.Conveniently close to La Rambla and so many other places of interest.On New Year's eve we were given packets of grapes and a leaflet explaining their significance which was a lovely gesture.The church bells added to the ambience but at times there was unnecessary internal noise when rooms were cleaned,loud conversations,slamming of doors etc. The service was very good,Katerina was always pleasant and patient whenever we needed help.Looking forward to returning to Barcelona and the Hotel Jardi again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: hdk1026
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel el Jardi for three nights at the end of September 2010. Had we known about the La Merce festival beforehand, we would have planned accordingly. As it was, our last night in Barcelona was the first night of the festival. We were on our way back to the hotel to pack, when we saw a fireworks display. Then, as we approached the hotel, we heard drumming. A troupe of drummers came marching through the narrow streets, with a large crowd following behind. We stopped to watch, and could not help but be swept up in the moment. The beat was mesmerizing. Later, back in our room, we heard the drumming approaching again. We stepped out onto our tiny balcony, and were entertained for the next hour by an amazing procession of dragons and drummers. Forget about packing... and getting a good night's sleep. Anyway, about the hotel... We had the tiniest double room I've ever been in, maybe a foot of space on either side of the bed. The bathroom was also small, but included all of the amenities. The breakfast was OK, nothing special. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. My only complaint about the place is the fact that the reception area is on the second floor, and there is no elevator, except on the upper floors. We had to lug our very heavy luggage up, but our driver carried it down when we left. This hotel is all about location. It is located in between two sqaures in the Gothic Quarter. The church of Santa Maria del Pi was right outside of our room. We were within easy walking distance to Las Ramblas and the Barcelona Cathedral, and a Metro stop was nearby. This is definitely a no frills hotel, but IMHO well worth the money. Would definitely stay here again, and plan our stay around the festival.

Reviews.Title: “Jardi Hotel would make a fabulous youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: StevieDG
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations of the Jardi. I blame the website. The history page and exterior shots elude to a comfy, historic boutique hotel in the heart of town. And indeed, the hotel is very old. Its just that the present owners ripped out all of the history and charm, leaving a promising exterior and an interior that is combination youth hostel and high school cafeteria. We *tried* our best to like it. But it was simply charmless. Furthering the youth hostel ambiance is the lack of any service whatsoever. You can get breakfast but that's really it. There is no lunch or dinner or restaurant. To do laundry you have to take your load down a small nearby alley to a laundry service. And while the student staff are all very kind indeed, the night manager is a gruff old fellah who seems to resent guests interrupting his nightly TV. We stayed in three different rooms. The highly priced terrace suite (and we can also blame the names for assuming the rooms are big) was just smaller than a Japanese love hotel room. The exterior suite was big enough for a double bed with a second single bed tucked in the corner, which would be good for a small family or a couple with a drunk friend. The interior rooms and singles rival cells in the Hanoi Hilton, without the room service. I will say its clean. The linoleum floors shine with spray cleaner. And the walls are adorned with 1 enlarged photo in each room, some with the digital camera date still emblazoned. We can consider the only amenities the towels, since a deposit is required for a TV remote or use of the in room safe. Positives? To kill the pain of the rooms and the charmless interior, and to win back my family's graces, we spent much of our time outside the hotel. And this is where the real win is-- the location is in the heart of the gothic quarter. Cafes, bars, and restaurants abound, as do many small shops and historic streets. Yet the beauty of the neighborhood does not compensate for what is really a misleading hotel. Were it billed as a youth hostel and were the rooms 30 euros cheaper, it would be a great deal and travellers' expectations would be met. If you are looking for the real thing though, a boutique hotel in the old quarter of Barcelona, you'll need to have a look at the Banys Oriental which was what the Jardi pretends to be. One final note: the owners of the hotel are delightful. I had to restrain myself from asking "why, why did you rip the soul out of this hotel and turn it into an IKEA showroom without furniture?" I suppose the answer is because they can.

Reviews.Title: “economical but so convenient”
Reviews.Author: sanji404
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardi is in a great location. It wasn't very fancy but was well worth the price. Great value. Loved the weekend market in the square right outside the front door of the hotel. The hotel staff was very helpful in where to go and what to do and really good at sending us in the right direction. Felt completely safe at this hotel. Only complaint - wifi internet was only available in the lobby and the chairs in the lobby weren't very comfortable. Hope to return one day. Pay attention when you walk out of the door because it's easy to get turned around and can be hard to locate.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Bawley
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at Hotel Jardi. The location was perfect for our short time in Barcelona. The room was small, but typical for Europe. Some of the reviews I read said that noise was a problem and we had no issues with that at all. The people watching from our balcony was great. The square that the hotel is located had plenty of places to eat and drink. We found that it was way cheaper and very easy to get there by the metro. We got off at the Liceu stop and it was easy to find from there. Of course the metro can bit a bit sketchy, especially carrying all of your luggage like we were. We found that having locks on our zippers worked well. (the one zipper that was left without a lock was opened by someone). That being said we never felt unsafe there. We were just steps away from Las Ramblas and the impressive market. Internet only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super staff, beds need improvement”
Reviews.Author: Heatherroc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardi is located in a great square location. Very picturesque especially if you request a terrace view room. The staff was very helpful and made our stay enjoyable. The beds need to be replaced as ours sloped inward making it very uncomfortable. Usually, we are very forgiving about such things, but it was not pleasant. I still recommend because of the great location and staff but maybe for one or two nights only.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-if nothing goes wrong”
Reviews.Author: sunny2384
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, although tiny rooms , great views over the plazas but unfortunately my partner broke both her arms in a fall and the man on the desk after midnight spoke no english and was not interested in helping us at all . There are 20 steps up to reception and I had to take a chair down to street level so she could sit while I ran up and down various flights of staris ( lift is very slow) trying to find another hotel where she could get into. My travel insurance peoepl were really helpful or I might still be there . The following day I returned to check out ( the reception guy woudl not let me checkout) adn found the phone company had charged me for all the reverse charge phone calls I had made to australia . The manager did sort it out over the next 36hours but I still had to sign off 1500 Euros on my creit card in case the phone company were going to charge the hotel . Next time I would have to choose a hotel where 1) the fax machine worked and 2)there was an active 24 hour reception .

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT book an interior room - very hot!”
Reviews.Author: mjcass5
Reviews.Content: We booked an interior room as a cost savings but didn't know that it didn't include a window. we lost a lot of sleep because the room was so hot and just wouldn't cool down. The room was also very tiny. Location was good but wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but very clean hotel with a friendly service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Davros27
Reviews.Content: Initially we were a little disappointed with the rooms as they were a lot smaller than we were used to. The door will almost brush your bed when you open it and the balcony door won't open unless you nudge your bed aside, HOWEVER, once you get over the size issue you will probably learn to love this hotel. It's clean and the girls at reception were very friendly and helpful. The hotel looks across two small squares, one had a food market selling jams, honey, wine, cheese etc at the weekend while the other had paintings for sale. There are numerous tapas bars and cafes within walking distance. For breakfast there's Cafe del Pi (just outside the hotel door) and a few others if you turn right and head through to the adjoining square. Location wise it's great. You're right inside the gothic quarter and walking distance from La Ribera. It's not hard to find somewhere to eat, drink or shop, and really pleasant to walk around at night. Just avoid Las ramblas if you're not a fan of tacky stalls, overpriced food/drink and crowds of people. David/Maria

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Small Shower!”
Reviews.Author: tiffany_traveler
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is perfect and was fairly easy to find. It's right off the train on Las Ramblas. The staff was very helpful in locating nice places to eat. The room itself was small (of course) but we opted for the room with a balcony and it was so worth it. The day we arrived we had ran out of clean clothes so we washed them and laid them in the sun to dry. My only major complaint about this place was the shower. Like many other reviews have said the shower was super small and in our case one of the doors actually came unattached. Overall, a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean and amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: sdoliber
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Jardi for 10 nights this past April. Although the room was very small and the shower the smallest I have ever seen, we were not in Barcelona to spend time in a hotel room. When we were there, however, the room was clean and comfortable with an amazing view of the Placa del Pi and the rose window of the Església de Santa Maria del Pi (we were in the last room overlooking the Placa del Pi on the 5th floor. A very short walk to all of the attractions of the gothic section and not even a minute to Las Ramblas, this hotel could not be beat for the money. We found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I've never staied in such a noisy and dirty place”
Reviews.Author: aniadrs
Reviews.Content: We booked a 85 Euro Double Room arround 7 p.m. and went out for catching the spanish atmosphere - came back arround 2 a.m. As the only window opened directly into Placa Maria del Pi, the noise and the echo of the noise was extraordinary alive, was like assisting to a live concert of voices in Babilonia..until 4 a.m. when the cleaning machine came and started making a waterfall noise while washing placa Maria del Pi.. this machine made the babilonian concert to stop, also being accopanied by a falling bottles noise. It was 6 a.m.when some different noise woke me up > they were fixing something with the hammer in the placa Maria del Pi ; many tables for merchandise souvenirs , tables handmade .. i couldn't sleep anymore ,also i tried alot. It was 9 a.m. when the noise stoped. We decided to have the coffee at the restaurant-bar under our balcony. There we found out that in the evening is going to be a spanish guitar concert in the church of Santa Maria del Pi. The 1 square meter bathroom had no other airsuply but our 10 square meter bedroom, the 10 sqm bedroom had only one opening window that went into our balcony, the balcony was sightseeing placa Maria del Pi. The towels provided by the hotel smelled and looked weird. No cleaning at the toilet also they said that the room is ready for guests. We moved our stuff to hostal Levante< 60 euro/night /double room > and had a wonderfull time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 11 and booked 6 rooms for three nights. This is a very basic hotel with a great location and a fantastic front desk staff. We had a variety of rooms, the large exterior or terrasse rooms being the best. The standard rooms were very small. Rooms were very clean and bathrooms newly updated. The elevator is very small. You can also book a shuttle for and from the train station or airport. No cars are allowed in the Gothic area. Public transport is very close and the waterfront is easily within walking distance. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. Martin, Leezia (sp) and especially Caterina were great. Caterina spent more than 45 minutes helping me recover a cancelled reservation at a hotel in Italy. It helped immensely that she is Italian and could make them understand the problem and come up with a solution. She must have made ten or twelve phone calls and would not accept and payment.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobia at its finest”
Reviews.Author: preppeone
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel couldn't be better. We enjoyed people watching over the square just outside our window, Las Ramblas was just steps away and the window sufficiently blocked out the night time noise outside for sleeping. Everything was very clean. Also, the staff was friendly and helpful, HOWEVER... Since I was traveling with a friend we had a room with 2 twin beds. There was no place in the room to move! Our suitcases had no where to go where we didn't have to climb over them to navigate through the room at all times. The shower literally was 2'x2' and when I wasn't accidentally turning the water off with an elbow bump, the water kept turning ice cold. The soap provided was smaller than that of the remains of a bar of soap I'd normally throw out - and with our 4-5 night stay, additional soap was never provided. The room was very college dorm-like, as was the lobby. Interior noise was louder than the exterior due to tile floors in the hallways and paper-thin walls. The elevator was about 6 steps up from the lobby and only large enough to hold one person and one large suitcase at a time. Although 80 euros a night seems reasonable for the location, it also seems somewhat over-priced for what we had. Continental breakfast was 6 Euros but only consisted of coffee/juice, 2 pieces of toast and a croissant. For 6 euros I would've thought maybe some fruit or something might be included. We also thought the practice of leaving our key at the front desk each time we came and went was a bit odd.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Affordable Family Run Hotel With Best Beds/Location!”
Reviews.Author: kreyes12
Reviews.Content: I am going to break down this review in several pieces. First: Rooms The beds were the most comfortable we had slept in all of Western Europe in our six week vacation. Take this into account that we had spent more money in many of the other Western European places. The room was impeccably clean everyday. The shower was the only one with a shower head. The a.c. was great and could be moderated to your liking. The t.v. had music channels and a safe was provided with a 20 euro deposit that you received upon checking out. Keep in mind that all of the other hotels we visited did not have a safe. Location: You couldn't ask for better. You will be in the center of it all. You are within a minute of the center of Las Ramblas. There are always people around and it is very safe. Hospitality: All staff are English speaking and exceptionally helpful. Services: There is a shuttle that will take you to and from the airport, similar prices if not better than a taxi, and way more reliable. We only took it to the airport and had a comfortable and safe ride from Tony. Tony was extremely knowledgeable about Barcelona and surrounding areas, friendly and fun to ride with. Contact the hotel about this service! The hotel offers discounted prices on tour buses that go around the city (amongst other services). Definitely inquire about this! VERY FAST WIFI THAT IS FREE! Things you should know before you go: There is one small flight of stairs before you reach reception. If you lack the strength to carry your bags up, ask the service desk for help (as other people may have complained about this). There is a laundry service close by, inquire by the front desk. Very reasonable prices and quick service. Overall, you should definitely consider staying here if you want to be in the middle of it all, feel safe and well taken care of!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Bring cash with you”
Reviews.Author: MGC78
Reviews.Content: If you are only looking for a centric place to stay and are planning to spend the day sightseeing and the night clubbing, this is the place for you. We had a lovely spacious and cleam room with a terrace (not for light sleepers...this is Spain!). Staff were very friendly too. The only negative comment I have is that they only take cash for transactions under 250 euros. This amount changes daily, I guess depending on how much cash they want to take without paying taxes. We were not informed of this when making the booking... so be ware!

Reviews.Title: “College Dorm Room Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Moongidget
Reviews.Content: This hotel is teeny weeny. Great location, and a superb tapas 'pay by the toothpick' restaurant nearby. The interior of the hotel was soooo noisy. (Exterior square noise as well) There is nothing to dampen the sound. We needed to sleep with ear plugs. Other guests were noisy in the halls. The way the elevator is situated, noise moves between floors. Guests smoked in the halls and in the non smoking elevator. We booked based on a Rick Steves recomendation, but we think he's way off. There must be a better hotel for the money in the area. Other than that, hotel was clean, front desk staff spoke English and were helpful. Breakfast is offered for 6 Euro extra.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION AND GREAT SKYLINE VIEW FROM BALCONY”
Reviews.Author: PMIDMI
Reviews.Content: Our first experience in Spain and it was wonderful. The hotel is right off Las Ramblas and has its own square with several cafes and a church (it was under construction so we could not go in). It sits in the middle of the Barri Gotic area that is packed with cafes, museums and churches/cathedrals. Close to the transit system as well to make your way around Barcelona. The room was small but adequate and we had a balcony with a great view of the Barcelona sky line and sunset. The staff was helpful when we had some trouble with using our credit card and also directing us to the car rental pick up. Overall a good experince.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, good location, clean”
Reviews.Author: bendersky
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a room at the last minute (the last one they had), and the staff did their best to accommodate us by moving us to a room with a window and a view. The room was small-ish, but comfortable, and the plaza on which it overlooked was scenic and fun. It was an easy walk to the Ramblas but far enough away to offer one a little bit of escape from the hub-bub. The area was still frequented by many, but not annoyingly crowded. Only one downside--do not, if you can at all help it (unless you like the quiet, cave-effect) take a room with "an interior view" (i.e. no external window). We stayed in one for one night and the room was fine, but a little...claustrophobic. El Jardi was great! For the money, don't expect the same room you would get in the U.S., but by Barca's standards, muy excellente!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed By Size Of The Rooms And Cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: WilliamD11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had pretty high hopes for this place given the location and some reviews we had read. We tried to maintain them even after we found out our room was only slightly larger than a postage stamp. We anticipated some street noise, but combining it with the noise within the building made sleeping difficult. That didn’t get any better when my wife encountered the largest cockroach we had ever seen hanging out in the bathroom. It was not what we needed after a long day of traveling. Granted, we checked in late during Easter weekend, so we were probably given the last room available. We left first thing the next day. The hotel we were set up with from the tourist information booth was infinitely more enjoyable. Perhaps the other rooms at Jardi are better. But I’m not willing to go back and find out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jans98
Reviews.Content: Ok - it is a budget hotel - so don't expect too much. My room was very small, but clean and with aircondition. So I think I got what I paid for. The Balcony is not one you can step out on... The Hotel is on a small and beautiful square, so hard to find better location in the centre of Barcelona. For the location alone I recommend this hotel. You can have your breakfast at caf'ees just outside the hotel. Jan

Reviews.Title: “Check your Room Out First Before Registering”
Reviews.Author: TwoEurophiles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to stay in the center of the old town in Barcelona and heard good things about Hotel El Jardi on the Placa San Josep Oriol. Location is excellent! Our room overlooked the busy side plaza, which was nice, but the room was so small we tripped over ourselves and the bed all the time - no extra room. We found out our room was one of the smallest and one of the most costly at 97euros. After hearing another couple check out, we looked at their room and it was twice the size and they paid just 70 euros. When we complained, our rate was quickly adjusted to 67 euros. There are no really special amenities but you're surrounded by restaurants and only a few blocks from the Rambla so we'd still recommend it. Just get room size and rates to match!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnMKEWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Located just off La Rambla. Great location. Very near Metro (L3-Liceu stattion) Spartan rooms. Don't be underwhelmed by lobby. Two nice squares outside hotel are quaint. If you ask for the top floor you'll probably end up with a roof-top terrace. Nice en-suite but tiny shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not for the claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_ExPatNorway
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardi has a fantastic location, on a relatively quiet square (no traffic, but activity on the square is noticeable with window open) close to La Rambla and about a 15-minute walk from the Metro stop at Placa Catalunya. We booked two standard rooms, one with balcony and one with window only, and found them modern and clean...but TINY! The beds were literally just inside the door, and the shower tended to spray the bathroom floor (as it took some adjusting with an outstreched arm to get a setting between scalding and freezing). I would describe Jardi as being of hostel standard, but with the privacy of a hotel. Have not experienced this size rooms in other European hotels...but perhaps the deluxe rooms are closer to normal size? The staff we met at the front desk were friendly and helpful, and spoke English without problems. All in all, fine for one night as a clean and convenient place to sleep, but not a good choice for the claustrophobic!

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonathanWade
Reviews.Content: El Jardí is a great little hotel, centrally located in the Barri Gotic neighborhood of Barcelona. Just steps away from La Rambla, it is a great starting point to exploring the city and the neighborhood. The hotel is very clean and our room overlooked a very charming plaza. The rooms are a little small and simple for US standards, but this is normal for European hotels and it was perfectly comfortable and as I mentioned, extremely clean and charming. The hotel staff was very attentive and went out of their way to help us every time we had questions or needed advice on things to do. If you haven't been to Barcelona, it is one of the greatest and most interesting cities to visit in the world. I hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: camberl
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to, clean and quiet. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: kmcdyer
Reviews.Content: The El Jardi is located just off of the Rambla in Barcelona. It is located in a square (plaza) about two or three blocks east of the Rambla and it is difficult for a car to get to the hotel during the day or evening. In spite of this drawback, the hotel was ideally located for site seeing since it is located close to the subway and bus lines. The hotel was very clean, the rooms were well organized and fairly typical of a European hotel. There was always a person on staff who could speak English. One other drawback was that we to carry our suitcases up one flight of stairs in order to get the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_DC
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at this hotel with my husband. Had asked for a room with a terrace on a high floor and this is exactly what we got. Room 52 was small but this was what we expected. Had a small standing room only terrace with amazing views onto Placa de Pi. Felt like you could touch the church it was so close!! There was a brilliant market in the square selling honey, cheese, wine, soaps and lots of other goodies. There was a great buzz and atmosphere. Staff in hotel were great, v helpful and lovely. Didn't eat breakfast in hotel, had great coffee and choc brioche in cafe next to the hotel for only 2. 40euros!! Shower was lovely and hot and bed v comfortable. Would not hesitate to recommend it to others. Location brilliant - 2mins walk off Las ramblas, 1 min walk to cathedral and about 20mins to the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: travelfanams
Reviews.Content: I followed Rick Steves' recommendation when I booked our room at Hotel Jardi. I cannot even explain my disappointment when I walked in to the smalled, most inadequate room I've ever seen in my life. My partner and I work and live in Europe, so we're very used to less than "American Standard" hotels, but this was ridiculous! Once I got over the tiny room, dirty (!!!) walls, tiny bed, and tiny bathroom/shower, I was reminded how bad this hotel was once night came. There were people coming in and out of the hotel literally all night. I went to Barcelona to relax and instead I left sleep deprived. If I had wanted to stay in a hostel I would have....for less than half the price To be fair, the location was great, but I would still never recommend this hotel/hostel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: markhughw
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel itself is safe, clean and comfortable. The air conditioning worked very well with no funky odors. Second, the service was fabulous. One minor downside is that there is no refrigerator in the room. However, they let you keep one item in their refrigerator or freezer, so we would alternate between a 1 1/2 liter of water (to freeze for the next day), a bottle of wine or a container of ice cream. You had to twist their arm for them to take a tip for this service. We like very firm flat beds and that's what we got. Since the price was so reasonable, we got the large room with three beds and a lovely balcony facing the square, which I highly recommend, even if it is just to have a larger room. The hotel was easily as nice as many three star hotels. Third, the location is really perfect, center of the old city where most cars are not allowed, easily walkable to most sites, very close to the Metro and many bus routes, two blocks from La Rambla, four blocks from the Cathedral, tons of restaurants, bars and shops, situated on three adjoining lovely plazas with outdoor restaurant and bar seating, an art fair on Saturdays, a market in the afternoon and evenings, occasional special events coming through. It was possibly best hotel all around for the money we've ever been. We didn't get the breakfast so I can't comment on that, but I would guess it is not as good as those at a three star hotel. I brought a plastic thermal tall coffee mug and got my cappuccino next door and poured it into my mug to go, and picked up a fresh seeded roll, tart or pastry and ate it outdoors in the square.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: Bethalto
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning at the Jardi and they were accomodating, letting us store our luggage in our yet to be made up room until later. After the obligatory "pinch me I'm in Barcelona" walk through the Barri Gothic, we came back and they let us move into our room around noon, which was ahead of the stated check in time. After a 2 hour nap we started our tour of teeming, amazing Barcelona. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful throughout our 5 night stay. The room itself was pretty small, even though we are veterans of these types of hotels throughout Europe. We adapted well, however, realizing that this is the price you must pay to stay in this perfect location in this wonderful city. No problem with noise, inside or out for us, though we stayed in a room facing the Placa del Pi over a long holiday weekend. If you value your time and want your hotel to be in the heart of the city, then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect location and helpfulness”
Reviews.Author: tiatake
Reviews.Content: hotel is in most beautiful plaza close to everything market restaurants bars, plaza catalunya, walking distance to gaudi houses, very good english speakers at desk , kind ,helpful ,knowledgeable, and cheerful rooms clean ,very adequate ensuite

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably noisy!!!”
Reviews.Author: ocanom
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean but monastic; staff courteous. Shower is miniature. But the real problem is the hotel is in a courtyard which creates a canyon effect for EVERY NOISE and there is lots of it since people are walking through at all hours of the day and night. In addition, trash is collected in the early hours of the morning (think 2:00 a.m.) since the very narrow streets in this area of Barcelona are fairly empty then. The noise amplification is incredible!

Reviews.Title: “It's clean and central and that's about it...if you want a good sleep go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: aotearoakid
Reviews.Content: I was more than disappointed with this place. After reading a few reviews and also seeing on the guardian and NY times sites I thought I'd give it a go. The woman on reception wasn't a great start (said hello without looking up from her desk). I was expecting basic and that's definitely what I got...but to honest I decided to write this review because if the staff had bothered to ask I would have told them that I had an awful stay at their hotel. The room was incredibly noisy. At night-time I could hear the restaurant down below scraping their chairs across the court-yard, (packing up). Then water flowing in the room next door - perhaps a shower...but the icing on the cake was hearing every word in reception as if the person was in the room. Someone asking for directions, saying good-night etc.. Never before have I stayed in a place with sound proofing as basic as this, or should I say non-existent. After finally managing to get to sleep I was woken up by the wake up call for someone next door at 6.30am (see what I mean about basic). Of course then the chairs at the restaurant downstairs started up again and that was it in terms of sleep at this joint. Bang on 11am the manager rung to say we needed to come out, just as we were leaving the room. I've travelled around the world and would rate this as a definite no-go. Other downers to note: wifi wouldn't connect on the i-phone, area is super touristy. If you want to enjoy the city, spend another 20 euros and avoid this joint if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArieleR
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a fantastic, and expensive, city. For what we paid, this hotel was great! It is right off of Las Ramblas on a lovely square. The room available when we booked had a full-sized bed and twin on the side. The room had a "dorm room meets hosptial" vibe; and not because it was exceptionally clean. It was just kind of blah. But again, great for the price. If you want a quiet night, don't bother visiting this part of Barcelona because you will not find it here. People are out and about all night, particulary on the weekends, but we were expecting that, so no complaints from us. If we'd had more money to spend, I would have loved to stay in the Exiample neighborhood, it was GORGEOUS! But Hotel Jardi was close to all of the Praca Catalunya, Las Ramblas, gothic Cathedral action, and was a great value. If you want to be close to the action, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: magicbrian
Reviews.Content: Location tends to be most things when doing a city break and in a city as lovely as Barcelona this is no exception. Bari Gotic is the oldest part of the city tucked behind the Cathedral and although just a few yards from La Ramblas, the feel is a world away. El Jardi , once two buildings , first became a registered hotel in 1860 . Since that time it thas enjoyed mixed fortunes. Fortunately this new century has meant a project to modernise this compact hotel situated in the old quarter and at the convergence of the Placa St Josep Orriol and Placa del Pi. The result is small rooms , the outer of which have bijou balconies or large windows which look out over the square. Inner rooms start at around 40 Euros but can be rather curiously configered so try and grab the outers starting at around 55 Euros with the charming views especially as you watch the city unfold in the early morning after its evening respite.. With one of the best locations in the city, this charming and rather quirky newly modernised hotel is well worth seeking out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Very Good B&B. Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MrB66
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this B&B for 4 nights. It was very good and very good value. We had a room with a balcony, overlooking a small squre. Charming. It is very close to the main area but we were not bothered by any noise. A TIP......... if you are taking a cab to the hotel, use their map from their web site. as we had trouble with cab drivers finding it even with their GPS and map books. Barcelona has a lot of small streets & squares off the main area ( Las Rambla). This did not affect our enjoyment of the hotel or Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “so nice in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: t2803h
Reviews.Content: stayed there 3 nights , what a nice place ! right in the middle of old barcelona overlooking 2 squares , quiet in such a buzzling city ! cheap prices , utmostly clean ! small rooms but fully equiped with showers , AC , tv ! wonderful multilingual staff ! another strong point : so close to restaurants , bars and tasty tapas places ! i fly a lot and usually stay for bizz in big so-called deluxe chain hotels and EL JARDI is a refreshing place ! do not forget to visit the city , the fantastic beaches with plenty of cheap restaurants and of course , barcelona nights ! the frenchy , paris

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful bargin hotel”
Reviews.Author: vanslamma
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are looking for a bargin in Barcelona. Get the extra large room with terrace, its only like 10 euros more, and totally worth it. The staff here is friendly, the rooms are kept very clean, and the location couldn't be better right in the heart of the Barri Gothic area and 2 minute walk to Las Ramblas. This is a hotel for people who don't spend hours at the hotel, mainly just want a safe, and clean place to sleep. with friendly staff. Also we actually were in Barcelona left for a few days to go to Paris and came back to this hotel. i had left my sweater, they kept it and gave it to me when I returned- very honest people.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST location in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: rocklady
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just off the Ramblas facing 2 squares and just an 8 minute walk from where the airport bus drops you off at Placa de Catalunya. You are very close to the Ramblas, but without the noise. Lots of places to eat or you can take breakfast at the hotel. Don't forget to try the ice cream at the shop next to the hotel. The rooms were small, but spotless and the a/c worked perfectly! If you want a larger bathroom, ask for one with a tub, otherwise you may get a shower stall only. The breakfast room faces the square and guests were able to use the room in the afternoon for reading, or relaxing. There is Wi-Fi if you bring your computer. The staff is helpful, courteous, and gracious. They let us leave some luggage at the hotel for a week since we had too much weight for a flight with Ryan Air. We couldn't have been happier with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Still great!”
Reviews.Author: Laenggass-Steffi
Reviews.Content: As the last review of Hotel Jardi is quite old, just a quick update: We loved the Hotel Jardi. The location is unbeatable, in the midst of the old town center, and the rooms are extremely clean. All this at a very attractive price level. We had a "large room exterior", but it wasn't exactly what I would call "large" in the traditional sense. Yet, it's all what you need to rest your tired feet after a long day out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - don't expect much and check your bill!!”
Reviews.Author: gwenberlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel. It looks great from the outside, but on the inside it rather looks like a hospital. The rooms were done without any desire for creating a warm atmosphere. Our room had a double bed and 1 single, but it was so small that we couldn't open our balcony doors completely since the bed was in front of it. The room was rather clean, but after cleaning towels were forgotten and the sheets had holes in them (my thumb could fit through). When we checked out, we were charged 108 euros instead of the 80 that was promised to me, and only after I could provide a printout of that mail, I got the price of 80 euros. Do keep your reservation mail with you, even when you discussed over phone ask for a written confirmation of the price! The breakfast room looks like the most miserable place on earth, do go outside, there is plenty of (cheaper and jolier) opportunities. Oh, and the elevator only starts on the 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Speak English and good bathrooms, but....”
Reviews.Author: MereBear1123
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights with 5 other girlfriends of mine as we were traveling to Barcelona. We picked it because the website looked good and it was right off Las Ramblas, plus the rates were inexpensive for us students. The rooms were something less to be desired, and my pillow was literally unfold-able - a complete brick. Some of my friends' rooms were unbearably hot! People were loud at night and there was even some pot smoking going on one night. On some floors, people left their doors open as if it was a hostel. The bathrooms were nice and the service was good, but this place is really only good for a one night stop in. I won't recomommend hosting your vacation here.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun, good value!”
Reviews.Author: Eastsideguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have travelled extensively through Western Europe (2-star to 4-star) and must say we enjoyed every minute of our stay at the nice, clean Hotel Jardi in Barelona late last summer. We stayed in an exterior double room (one big bed) with sun terrace. Room 84 was simple. Simply great. Just a nice double bed, a chair, small TV with a few Cable channels, TV stand with helpful drawers, nice, big closet with a safe, a tiny, clean functional bathroom, and the best part -- a spacious sun terrace (with table and two chairs) overlooking the beautiful square and church. New air conditioning kept our room cool during very hot summer days. Only faults, small ones, would be very tiny bathroom and normal hotel noises (folks next door, old plumbing in ceiling), but these complaints may be silly, considering Barcelona is the loudest city in Europe. The nice young people on the front desk were always helpful, from recommending a restaurant to calling a taxi to the airport on a busy morning. The hotel felt safe, with a 24-hour desk clerk and a new, clean lobby monitored by a very large security camera, but many parts of the Gothic Quarter can be unsafe late at night. The desk clerks warned us to be very careful after dark, so take their advice. As for eating, the hotel’s breakfast room was nice, with one view table that’d be sweet, but I would agree that it is cheaper and more fun to eat down in the square, especially the popular coffee shop next to the hotel. The Hotel Jardi is as advertised -- a nice, clean, cool, affordable place to stay in the heart of Barcelona's Gothic Quarter. --S.L., Portland, OR

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: on-a-coffee-break
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location just off the Rambles within minutes walk of many sights and the Metro for visiting things further afield. It is just a short walk from Placa Catalunya too where you can catch the A1 airport bus for getting in an out of the city for a few Euros. Do be aware this is not a luxury hotel and you get what you pay for. The rooms are small and it can be quite noisy - especially as it is on a busy square with two cafes in the heart of the city and the walls of the rooms are thin. However I've been to Barcelona several times and have generally found most hotels to be pretty dire unless you pay big money - this being the best cheaper one I've found so far with the superb location being the best aspect. For other things to do, on weekends there are farmers and artists markets on the square. If you are fit and fancy a different way of seeing the city, hire bikes from the end of the Rambles (under the Columbus Statue). If you fancy posh tapas the Taller de Tapas restaurant on the same square is excellent. There are frequent spanish guitar concerts in the church on the square as well. For all other things the hotel reception staff are friendly and very helpful. Don't pay for breakfast, the cafes on the square are half the price. Overall an enjoyable stay. I will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2210
Reviews.Content: Good location but buses, and most cabs,are not allowed in this area. Service was very poor. Our room was cleaned one day and not the next. The elevator, is installed only from the second floor up. There is also a bad odor that permeates this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Sharptooth
Reviews.Content: This is the percfect place to stay for a short trip to Barcelona. It is a short distance off La Ramblas and at about the midway point of La Ramblas. Because it's tucked back a little ways you don't get all the noise from La Ramblas but it's only a few minutes walk away. You are close to the big market on La Ramblas and not far from the Bari Gothic area with the cathedral. You are also surrounded by many shops and restaurants. The hotel staff is very nice and helpful. The room was small but clean. My only complaint is the shower was the smallest I have ever seen! If you drop something you'll have to open the doors to be able to bend down and pick it up! I was worried my husband wasn't going to fit in the shower and he is a regular sized guy. He did fit but would hit the shower control when he turned around. If you can handle a small shower and won't be spending loads of time in your room this is a great budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, EXCELLENT LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: ssgk
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's a tiny room with a tiny bathroom. It's Europe, what do you expect for the money? This place is a good deal for Barcelona, especially for the location which is smack in the middle of it all in the Barri Gotic. Hubby and I are mid-aged travellers on a budget. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Day and eve staff speak English. Only drawback: the beds feel like box springs, very uncomfortable, rough sleeping. If you can handle that, I highly recommend to place. Skip the hotel breakfast & eat at the Boqueria or a nearby chocolate shop...good & cheap! Barcelona is at your fingertips from here. People who like to complain about everything should stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in a big city”
Reviews.Author: Booshan
Reviews.Content: Fab location for getting anywhere in Bacelona. We got the bus from the airport (4 euros), took us approx 10 mins to walk to the hotel from the bus. The little square its on is really cute, but be warned it's not quiet, but you are in the centre so I wouldn't expect any less. Markets etc start setting up at 9am ish, and the bells from the church next door start at 8am, so if you're a light sleeper take your earplugs. It really is a perfect location for discovering Barcelona, lots of coffee and pastry places nearby so you never get caught short. Service wasn't what I'm used to but I partly think its a culteral thing, I don't think they do it on purpose. Overall, very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SpikeDaisy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a relatively quiet square just off the Ramblas. It is an awesome location to be close to all the action without having to sleep right on it. Depending on the staff members present the service can range from wonderful to below average. Be aware that if you ask for restaurant recommendations, they may recommend a place they get a commission from. The rooms are basic and clean. Not anything to complain about for the location and value. A few drawbacks were no computer for internet access (they do have free wi-fi in the lobby), and some staff were not particularly helpful. Just a few tips to hopefully enjoy your time in Barcelona better: Bus Turistic is a handy and convenient way of seeing all the sites in the city. The sites in Barcelona are a little more spread out than some other cities (ie Madrid). You can hop on/hop off at the major sites. The tickets for a one day pass are 23 euros and 26 for two days. You get a coupon booklet that almost pays for half of your ticket price to most major sites. There is a great tapas bar located really close to the hotel called Taverna Basca Irati. Also make sure to try Cafe de l'Academia for a nice dinner. It is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel just off of Placa S. Jaume. It was our favorite restaurant during our whole trip in Spain. Make sure to have reservations, otherwise you may not have much luck getting a table. About 13 euros per plate.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: buzzybuzzybee
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in this hotel in March. Brilliant location, just off the Ramblas. Yes it does have small rooms with small showers but generally speaking you don't spend long in the hotel room if you are only there for the weekend. Reception staff were helpful in every way and we had no problenms. We were so handy for all the places we wanted to go or closeto the transport system to take us there. The square outside our window had something going on most of the time, either an artists market or music in the evening. A few bars were also open. The fantastic market is five minutes away and if you walk through to the back and exit to the right there is a little cafe that does fabulous breakfasts for the same or similar prices to those in the hotel, much better than thos on the Ramblas. Please take care of your bags in Barcelona, we witnessed several pickpockets operating in the area close to Gaudis house and the chimney pot house, they work in teams so you don't get suspicious. Make sure you donot have your purses or wallets in your bag at your side always have it across your body at the front. One english couple had no idea they were being robbed until we shouted out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SLR75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel El Jardi in June 2008. The location was perfect! So close to everything. We stayed in an interior room. Small room, small bathroom but very clean. Weren't in room much so the lack of windows did not bother us. Definitely recommend for a budget option when you want something a little more than a backpackers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MeganHope20
Reviews.Content: My fiance stayed at this hotel in June 2008 and we were amazed by how tiny the standard exterior room was that we stayed in. It was definitely clean and comfortable but you have to be able to tolerate small spaces. In our room the shower was tiny and I assume that the other rooms in the hotel have similar bathrooms. Would not recommend this hotel for a large person because I am 5'6 and 120 lbs and I had trouble in that shower. Staff was nice and helpful. Great location. Right off of La Rambla and close to a major metro hub and right in the middle of a shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: kacmac
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardi is in a great location in Barcelona. Just steps from the metro stop Liceu. Short walk to the Catedral and Barri Gotic. Helpful reception staff. Balcony overlooking square was great. Small rooms, small bathrooms and thin walls. Great for a short stay when not much time planned in room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: julie1768
Reviews.Content: May 23-25, 2008 We stayed at the Hotel Jardi for two nights. The location couldn't be beat. We had a balcony which overlooked the Placa Pi and we enjoyed being able to overlook the bustling square. I have to admit that the street cleaners coming in at night (usually around midnight) was a bit of a disturbance, but the idea of them cleaning at that hour was also surprising to me. It was, however, nice to know that we would walk out to a tidy area outside the next day. The hotel staff was very helpful and the best part was they could speak English very well. Our room was tidied up every day when we returned from sightseeing and, although a bit cramped, it was comfortable for what we needed, a place to relax and lay our head. To sum up, for the price and location I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: robin131
Reviews.Content: While well located, our room was so small you could not open the door with your suitcase out. Bathroom equally small with tiny shower. Staff did not give accurate info (said no fountain show, not true) told us to eat at an expensive restaurant which was lousey. Needed to make calls after loosing credit cards and they said they didn't know how to place a collect call or reach an operator, so ended up with $200 in phone charges. I am pretty sure I remember giving them e40 for the safe key depost (can't prove it) and got e20 back. Asked for complaint book, they couldn't produce one. Walls were thin and could hear neighbors. Has an elevator once you go up a lot of steps.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Cold, Basic”
Reviews.Author: paulrevere1773
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for 4 walls, a ceiling, a bed, all in a safe building, in the perfect location, this is your hotel. You don't get anything else. The location is absolutely perfect. Right off of the Las Ramblas. Right in the Gothic Quarter. Safe. Beautiful area. Right next to the church, Santa Maria Del Pi. You get in the hotel lobby and you either get a [--]Spanish woman who hardly speaks English or a laid back Australian dude. They give you your giant key. You go to your room... take the steps please, don't try the weird elevator. The room is literally a room with cold floors. There is a bed. There is a table. There might have been a TV but I doubt it. The bathroom was basic, but everything worked. Whenever you leave, you must drop your key off at the front desk. You can come and go 24/7, which separates this place from a hostel. One cool thing is that many rooms have a balcony facing the front of the building. The balcony looks over a beautiful square and the church. This gets pretty busy in the day time with people... no cars are allowed in this area. I actually proposed to my girlfriend on the balcony at night. All in all, if you want a cheap option that is an upgrade from a hostel, stay here. It's definitely not like a regular hotel though. Just an old apartment building converted into a "hotel".

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, noisy, and a little shower, but well situated.”
Reviews.Author: caninde2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and me were in Jardi for 3 nights. We were in 3 floor. Expensive, 106 Euros for a hostal! Noisy. You can hear people arrive and way out. We couldn't sleep very well. The bathroom is a joke. It was so small I couldn't wash my feet in the shower. The only good thing: Jardi is good situated, near subway and many interesting places (Las Ramblas, La Boqueria Market, gothic city, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Price and Location can't be beat.”
Reviews.Author: fordtraveler56
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardi in Barcelona has to be in one of the best locations in town. Located on Placa PI there was plenty to do just outside the door of the hotel and less then 2 blocks away was La Rambla and Metro stop Liceu . We had a room on the 3 floor with a balcony and the complaints about noise and size of room weren't an issue for us. We found the staff wasn't as cordial as we are use to but they spoke English and that was a help since our Spanish isn't to good. Didn't try breakfast because there are so many spots available to grab something nearby. For the price would stay there again but would pay the little extra to have a room on the 3rd floor with the extra space. Took a taxi to Sants train station for an early am departure and feel we were way overcharged, so a word of caution is to ask the price before you ride.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly front desk australian woman”
Reviews.Author: hasenbund
Reviews.Content: was there in april2008 for 4 nights.the area is nice,but its really noisy the whole night in the hotel.you can hear everything,like shower from other rooms,talking,screaming and so on.but the worst was the check out.i made my reservation with e-mail (3times),also made reconfirmation one week before arrival,all with the same price off 88 euro per room.but when i checked out this australian woman wanted to charge me 28 euros more.i had my printed mail with me so i showed her that i have arranged this 88 euros per night.she said ,that she is sure someone at the check in informed me that the roooms are more expensive now.but it was not.than she told me a lier and she was quite agressive and said afterwords there are enough hotels in barcelona,no one has to stay in this hotel.this was my bad experience in this hotel,i can no one recommend this hotel.i travel around a few times a year,but never heard staff talking like this.

Reviews.Title: “Agreat base for this wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Owl-2
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great four day break in Barcelona – our first visit to the city. We booked everything rather last minute so my first three choices for hotels couldn’t take us. So, based on reviews on Trip Advisor and in a recent travel supplement review, we booked into the Hotel Jardi. In short, we got exactly what we had been led to expect from this hotel. The best thing about the hotel is its location and eternally pleasant staff. The hotel is on the lovely Plaza Sant Josef Oriol and although I would not agree with other reviewers who claim the location is quiet, it is not on a main road and it is probably a lot quieter than many other parts of the city. The plaza was charming with plenty options for breakfast within a stone’s throw of base. The hotel offers good value (we paid just less than £300 for four nights in an external larger double room with a balcony). Now, don’t expect to have space to practice your salsa in these ‘large’ rooms and the balcony is crowded with two people standing on it, but the location is great, the views are lovely and there is a nice ‘feel’ about the place. In short we would stay there again, especially since you don’t actually spend a lot of time in your hotel on these weekend breaks. I would probably suggest that you don’t have breakfast at the hotel – why would you with so many wonderful options within a five minute walk. Yes, the little square is lovely but why not walk five minutes to the Boqueria Market just across the Ramblas from the hotel and dine like a king with the locals? We had the most amazing wild mushrooms, served up with asparagus and a little fresh pesto, on homemade bread. Or head out the back, right-hand door of the market and have the best Spanish breakfast in town on the sunny terrace of ‘Ra’.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our New Year's week in Barcelona and stayed in Hotel Jardi. Like the prior reviews here, it was kind of tough getting there because the cab driver dropped us off at La Rambla and although it was relatively close to the hotel, it was a pain because we had several luggages. Then, here comes the stairs ...and it was not fun, especially if you're lugging off several pieces of luggages!!! Nobody was there to help you either! PROS - The major asset of this hotel is its location. We had a room with balcony facing the courtyard and it was worth paying the extra 6 euros per night to get this room. We watched the hustle and bustle of activities going on at Plaza del Pi from our balcony. It's close proximity to La Rambla and to the Liceu Metro Station is a BIG PLUS. We walk up and down La Rambla, from the Colon statue to Plaza Catalunya. La Boqueria Market is about 5 minutes from the hotel as well. There is also a huge supermarket along La Rambla that have very reasonable prices. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They offer breakfast on site though we never ate there as there are several other places to eat nearby. The cleaning staff cleaned our room on a daily basis. CONS - Our room was VERY spartan.
