We have the standard double room, and having just stayed in a timeshare facility in Italy prior to coming here....we wanted to turn around and move to a different hotel. The bathroom was very small, especially the shower. My husband feels claustrophobic everytime he takes a shower. For the price that we paid for this hotel, especially since its during the holidays...I could say that it's worth it. I might come back again if I don't see anything that's as good of a location that'll cost the same. However, I will probably search around first.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Lulu031
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located down a couple of winding narrow streets off the main thoroughfare, La Ramblas. It faces a lovely little square with restaurants, gelato, and a wonderful old church. We had a very small room on the 8th floor - there is a lift - but it had an amazing terrace with wonderful views over the rooftops. We often sat there at dusk, drinking champagne and snacking on yummy titbits we had bought at the markets which were just off the other side of La Ramblas. The bathroom was comparatively large and very clean. The location was also quite near the main Catalunya Square which we reached by walking through mainly pedestrianised streets with great shops. The hotel desk people spoke English and were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: aussieAl_61
Reviews.Content: A small hotel in a great location. It is just off La Rambla overlooks two plazas near a large old cathedral. An incedible atmosphere. A great base for exploring all the narrow streets in the older part of Barcelona. Metro station 200 m away. The rooms were clean, of good size and recently updated. The reception staff spoke good English (we didnt know any Spanish). I have no hesitancy in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills Comfort”
Reviews.Author: MPortland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a plaza about a block off Las Ramblas. Our room was small, spare and sufficiently comfortable and clean but not terribly attractive. The best feature was the huge balcony and double glass doors. We were on the top floor so we also had a view across the rooftops and were able to see fireworks one night. Our room was very near the belltower next door so the bells were LOUD! They were humorously loud enough to add to the charm of the place for us. We could have closed the doors, but why not experience it all? The staff was a changing cast of people who looked like students and may not have had a lot of insider info, but were eager and helpful. We didn't try the breakfast in the little plain room off the lobby as there were nice places nearby with good food and more charm. We agree with the preceding writer that there are many, many stairs before you reach the elevator. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: BigMikeW
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great location, very near "La Rambla" in the old city. In a few minutes, can walk to most of the old city sites. The plaza that this hotel is on has coffee shop, gelato, artists and a food market. It's not a luxury property but we only paid 98 E per night. One caution: the hotel is about 2 flights up from the street before the elevator. If you have alot of luggage (we did) be prepared for some exercise. (no one helps) Also, the elevator is tiny: 2 feet by 4 feet! All in all, a great value with reasonable expectations. Also, private bath was fine and spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sol74
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a beautiful city and I really appreciated the great location of Hotel El Jardi. On a quaint little square, very quiet and clean, with a multilingual staff who were very helpful. We stayed in a small double interior room to save some money but if you want a larger room, I highly recommend the exterior rooms with a balcony. Breakfast is 6 euros and consists of pastry, coffee, and orange juice. Honestly we just ate at the ice cream/cafe next door on the corner and got the same breakfast for 2-3 euros. The Boqueria (market) is very close and it is also fun to eat in there for a more reasonably priced breakfast. I would definitely stay at El Jardi again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: emaurer
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Hotel El Jardi the 21st-23rd of September, and were very happy with it. We booked a large exterior room. The room was very clean, and the bathroom and room were both very spateous. We had a small balcony on the 4th floor which was nice for looking over the square, but was plenty quite at night because of the doors thick double paned windows. We were also very happy with its location. It is probably only a 2 minute walk to La Rambla which is close enough that we never felt unsafe walking to it late at night. The streets leading to it and the square it sits in always had some people in them until probaly 12:30 or 1 in the morning. It is also far enough from La Rambla that it was never to loud or crowded by the hotel. The staff all spoke good English and were very helpful in giving us directions and arranged a taxi for us back to the airport. We loved Barcelona and the Hotel El Jardi.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this place - not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: drtryba
Reviews.Content: Okay - I guess you should expect less from a pensione - but for almost $100 us a night - this place sucked. It was really small and very "dorm-like". Just offered the basics - very old. I do have to say it is in a great location - but the reception people smoked in there everyday - it killed me bc there was no ventilation. Save your money and stay somewhere else - dont be fooled by the nice website either - this place is a dive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: xyztravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in mid-September. The location was great: right on two quaint squares, a few minutes from the Ramblas and within easy walking distance of the port, the Cathedral and Placa Catalunya. Our only complaint was the room size: it was literally so small it pretty much fit just the bed. (There was chair in there when we arrived and we had to bring it downstairs in order to have a place for our suitcases.) The bathroom was also ridiculously small: you couldn't bend over in the shower. However, we felt like we got a good deal for our money considering the prime location. Note: if you're taking a taxi from the airport make sure to tell them the hotel is on Placa Sant Josep, not just Sant Josep as in the street. We didn't make this clear and ended up 3/4 of a mile away being dropped off on the side of the street while the cab driver made some gestures with his arms and then drove away. Apparently the street Sant Josep is under construction and not open to cars.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and full of fun and warmth, a great stay”
Reviews.Author: LongDaysJourneyInto
Reviews.Content: My friend and I finally got a room as someone else actually cancelled. Initially I booked us into the much more expensive Hotel Colon (we then spotted it during our walks in Barcelona), I have no doubt that that would have been a terrific stay too, but the Jardi, is a whole new experience altogether, and one to be cherished. We got a large room, 3 beds (though there were only 2 of us) and on the corner of the building, which meant that we had 2 balconys, each of them overlooks a square of which Barcelona has so many. It was quirky, simple, exceedingly clean. The bathroom is on the small side, but clean and it does the job. It is located just off La Ramblas, and within easy distance of the Picasso Museum, and the charming old town. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel, and with the price as it is, you must give it a try!!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the jardi”
Reviews.Author: happy_travels_2all
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a corner room that had 2 windows overlooking a small square. it was conveniently located, just a couple of blocks off the chaotic and busy ramblas. it's only a couple of minutes to walk to the ramblas (mid-ramblas), 5 minutes to the cathedral, less than 10 minutes to placa de catalunya, maybe 30 minutes to casa mila/la pedrera. taking a taxi from parc guell cost about 8 or 9 euros. the room was a good size - it didn't feel small or cramped with 3 single beds. the bathroom was a bit tight, but not unexpected. both the room and bathroom were very clean. although the windows weren't double-paned, we have no complaints about the room being noisy. the only time we really heard anything was when a street performer did his thing in the square right outside the window. we found we had great seats for his mediocre show. the hotel staff was pleasant enough, allowing us to store our luggage in the breakfast room both before and after our stay, and called a taxi to take us to the airport (25eur) we didn't eat breakfast, so can't comment on that. overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: MazeyPuppy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the end of April. We had a room overlooking the square which was pleasant, but the balcony is not what I'd call a balcony, just a large window. The room itself was tiny as was the bathroom, on the plus side it was clean. Very uncomfortable bed and noisy room - poor sound-conditioning. All in all we had a great holiday but sleeping in our own home again came as a great relief! I would not recommend this hotel... I didn't think it was value for money, I know Barcelona is expensive but I am sure you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Latsydney
Reviews.Content: We loved those hotel. Had a room with a balcony, overlooking a courtyard, the room was small but sufficient. Bathroom was also small, but very clean and looked like newly renovated. We also stayed in an interior room one night which had a much bigger bathroom. Very well located, a short walk to many attractions, metro, surronded by places to eat and great shopping. It is also a 5-10 min walk from where the airport bus drops off and picks up. Would definately stay here again, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean, and Great Location on a Cute Square”
Reviews.Author: khoward
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little hard to find from the Metro stop at Liceau, but is SO close to La Ramblas, great shopping, transportation, and sights. It was a pretty small room, and even smaller bathroom. But, it was completely clean, and the staff were very helpful and nice. You cannot beat the price for the location. It's on a very cute little square with a market that opens during the day. There are tons of places to eat breakfast, and the quintessential Churros con Chocolate cafe is just around the corner! All in all, this was perfectly located, at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter35
Reviews.Content: I was part of a group of travellers in April who stayed in Hotel Jardi. I stayed in two different rooms- a standard room with two beds on the top floor, facing the hotel's interior. I then switched rooms (due to the group arrangement- not because of the room) and stayed in a triple facing the exterior courtyard/ally. I preferred the first room, despite its odd shape (shaped sort of like a slice of pie?) as it was much quieter and had a larger bathroom. I found the staff to be extremely friendly, mostly non-Spanish residents and the location was perfect. I was not expecting a 5 star hotel with the low price paid, and thus was content with the product I received. I only wish that there were an elevator that went to the bottom floor, so that I did not have to drag my luggage to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Jardi was pefect for our visit!”
Reviews.Author: Lutece1717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an excellent stay at Hotel Jardi. We had room 43 on the fourth floor with a balcony and view of the church and courtyard area below. A good deal at 98 Euros per night, particularly for the location! The room was clean, clean, clean! Not a scuff on the white walls anywhere. The bathroom was sparkling and very large by European standards. Great water pressure, too. In reading other negative reviews, I feel like we stayed at another hotel! Maybe it's best to stick to rooms on the upper floors? Our room was actually a triple, but there were just two of us in a double bed. When I booked the room originally, they didn't have a room with a double bed and exterior view available. So, I booked an exterior view room with two twin beds. However, about a week after I booked, they called and said they had a better room available and did I want it, which I thought was great customer service! Front desk staff was very nice, and the location is just fantastic. We took the metro very little as so much was within walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: uribes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during our trip around Spain. I have to admit that even tough the location of the hotel is excellent, the hotel was not good at all. I had asked for a room with a balcony and a view. They gave us a room in the first floor behind the kitchen overlooking a small plaza. The view was great but we felt the noise from the kitchen and the flushing of toilets all night long. The room also has a strange smell. Since it was on the first floor we could not leave the balcony door open at night for security reasons so we had to use the A/C which was old and noisy. We asked the front desk for a room change but they were not nice at all at the point to not even consider switching us. I had made the reservations with 2-3 months in advance but they did not care. The bathroom was small and the shower door broke. The bed and towels were also bad quality. I would never stay in this hotel again. If this is the only one around for your budget, make sure to ask for a room in the top floors and with a view to the plaza but consider a different hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: guilford104
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Jardi is very basic but clean and very well located. All of our email correspondence making reservations and getting directions from them was very easy. All of the desk clerks speak fluent English. The location, off Las Ramblas is good and the hotel is right on a lovely little square not far from the Cathedral. There are no bell hops and even though there is a small elevator you still have to get the luggage up to the reception level which is a long flight of stairs. Our room had a small balcony overlooking the square. This is a no frills place but well run and clean. Not for older travellers I would say, the elevator sometimes does not run well and it has 5 floors of rooms. Note: you have to pay in cash unless your room bill is over 250 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Anyone”
Reviews.Author: Zypcio
Reviews.Content: Actually a very decent place to stay in, located in a quiet & yet tourist packed street, it resembles a little courtyard. Near an old church (bells arent loud) & other stores, cafes. Area is safe, off near the main street. Entrance is a bit haphazard as there are steps to climb w/ your heavy luggage. Stairs to elevator even more difficult. Elevator a bit thin but I fit in. Rooms are spacious, a bit cold though as there was no heating in room but extra blankets provided. Walls gruffy & snuffy but not that bad. Floor needs to get a warm carpet but other than that it was a nice place to get back to at night. Bathroom clean & maintained, shower nice. Staff is composed of friendly foreign students who really try to help you w/ city places, maps, sites, etc. (One of them was smoking which was a minus). No noise at all from guests at night or from street. Window is sound resistant, great view of church square w/ cafes. Town market nearby. Metro in vicinity. I really enjoyed the location & the view from the floor. Great place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Jardi deserves all the praise we had heard.”
Reviews.Author: Margjorie
Reviews.Content: On Trip Advisor and other sites we had read good things about Hotel Jardi. We also have friends who recommended we stay there, knowing we would enjoy the neighborhood. It is a lower priced hotel with no frills, but everything we wanted in a room, and more. We had a balcony and another set of double windows opening on a square (which was a delightful place in which to have a meal, a coffee, or a glass of wine). The rooms are clean, the staff friendly and helpful. We would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - provided ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I recently spent a couple of days at the Jardi - it was just beautiful. However, there are a couple of things to be aware of. The hotel is virtually a pension. It is spotlessly clean and the staff (in particular the beautiful receptionist), are terrific. We had asked for an external room, but this was not available on the first night. The internal room was clean, but small and definitely nothing to write home about. The external room we had on the second night was lovely. It overlooked the beautiful square and we could look down on the umbrellas and the art display on show on the weekend. The basilica in the square was beautiful and we went to a live performance by a well known Spanish guitarist on the Sunday night. The atmosphere was priceless. I would love to stay again, but only if I had an external room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 nights at the Hotel Jardi, and were ready to become long-term residents by the end of the stay! The hotel was wonderful, the staff extremely pleasant and helpful. We had an 8th floor balcony room overlooking the placa. Very quiet, except for the cathedral bells and the occasional accordian player below. I was struck! So convenient to everything needed for a top notch stay in Barcelona. I will stay here again on my next trip to Barcelona, no questions asked!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Jardi”
Reviews.Author: ledris
Reviews.Content: We just spent 1 night in the hotel Jardi on Nov. 10, 2005. The hotel was very clean but very very small. The location to La Rambla was terrific, a 2 minute walk. Our room was on the 5th floor across from the elevator. This was no problem as it was off season and very quiet. I would imagine that during the "In" season it would be not the greatest room to have because of the additional noise from the elevator. We had a small double bed. After we got our 3 suitcases in there was hardly any room to move around. We had a bath with a shower. There was no hairdryer. (I bring my own always) However, they would rent you one for 10E. There was a safe in the teeny closet which also had a fee. There were french doors that opened onto a small square that included a church. Not really any cars. However, the noise that came up from this square ALL night long kept us up most of the night. It was just awful. To get to the lobby of the hotel you have to climb up 24 stairs and carrying 2 carryons and 1 large suitcase was quite the hassle after our cab let us off on La Rambla. We had to walk to the hotel which was only like one block. This was no problem. But the stairs were. Then after checking in, you had to walk up 6/7 more stairs to the tiny elevator. (I am thinking that most elevators in Europe are tiny) There was room for 1 person and 2 carryons/or just two people and no luggage. We had breakfast in the morning at the hotel. Toast, croissant, jam, orange juice(not fresh) and a cup of coffee each. It was 5.50E/person. Since we wanted to do a few minutes of shopping this was the best bet and it was pretty decent. The people in the lobby were very very helpful and friendly. They called a cab for us in the morning and it came right to the door! We were surprised since the night before the driver left us off on La Ramble. Again taking the suitcases down those stairs was a hassle. Would I stay there again, Yes but unless I had a bigger room, only for one night. Ours was a Standard Exterior room for 86E/night NOT including breakfast.
